ozpIwc.KeyBroadcastLocalStorageLink.name: ozpIwc.KeyBroadcastLocalStorageLink
ozpIwc.KeyBroadcastLocalStorageLink.description:
This link connects peers using the HTML5 localstorage API. It is a second generation version of the localStorageLink that bypasses most of the garbage collection issues.

When a packet is sent, this link turns it to a string, creates a key with that value, and immediately deletes it. This still sends the storage event containing the packet as the key. This completely eliminates the need to garbage collect the localstorage space, with the associated mutex contention and full-buffer issues.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration for this link

props.name: peer
props.description: The peer to connect to.

props.name: prefix
props.description: Namespace for communicating, must be the same for all peers on the same network.

props.name: selfId
props.description: Unique name within the peer network.  Defaults to the peer id.

props.name: maxRetries
props.description: Number of times packet transmission will retry if failed. Defaults to 6.

props.name: queueSize
props.description: Number of packets allowed to be queued at one time. Defaults to 1024.

props.name: fragmentSize
props.description: Size in bytes of which any TransportPacket exceeds will be sent in FragmentPackets.

props.name: fragmentTime
props.description:
Time in milliseconds after a fragment is received and additional expected
fragments are not received that the message is dropped.

ozpIwc.LocalStorageLink.name: ozpIwc.LocalStorageLink
ozpIwc.LocalStorageLink.description:
This link connects peers using the HTML5 localstorage API. It handles cleaning up the buffer, depduplication of sends, and other trivia.

Individual local storage operations are atomic, but there are no consistency gaurantees between multiple calls. This means a read, modify, write operation may create race conditions. The LocalStorageLink addresses the concurrency problem without locks by only allowing creation, read, and delete operations.

Each packet is written to it's own key/value pair in local storage. The key is the of the form "${prefix}|${selfId}|${timestamp}". Each LocalStorageLink owns the lifecycle of packets it creates. For senders:

  1. Write a new packet.
  2. Wait config.myKeysTimeout milliseconds.
  3. Delete own packets where the timestamp is expired.
For receivers:
  1. Receive a "storage" event containing the new key.
  2. Reads the packets from local storage.

The potential race condition is if the packet is deleted before the receiver can read it. In this case, the packet is simply considered lost, but no inconsistent data will be read.

Links are responsible for their own packets, but each will clean up other link's packets on a much larger expiration window (config.otherKeysTimeout). Race conditions between multiple links interleaving the lockless "list keys" and "delete item" sequence generates a consistent postcondition-- the key will not exist.

params.name: config
params.description: - Configuration for this link

props.name: peer
props.description: - The peer to connect to.

props.name: myKeysTimeout
props.description: - Milliseconds to wait before deleting this link's keys.

props.name: otherKeysTimeout
props.description: - Milliseconds to wait before cleaning up other link's keys

props.name: prefix
props.description: - Namespace for communicating, must be the same for all peers on the same network.

props.name: selfId
props.description: - Unique name within the peer network.  Defaults to the peer id.

ozpIwc.LeaderGroupParticipant.name: ozpIwc.LeaderGroupParticipant
ozpIwc.LeaderGroupParticipant.description:
Baseclass for APIs that need leader election. Uses the Bully algorithm for leader election. Implementer is responsible for handling two events:
  • "becameLeaderEvent" - participant has finished its election process and is to become the leader. Handle any logic necessary above the LeaderGroupParticipant and then trigger the participant's event "becameLeader" (ex. participant.events.trigger("becameLeader")
  • "newLeaderEvent" - participant has finished its election process and is to become a member. Handle any logic necessary above the LeaderGroupParticipant then trigger the participant's event "newLeader" (ex. participant.events.trigger("newLeader")

props.name: name
props.description: The name of this API.

props.name: electionAddress
props.description:
The multicast channel for running elections.  
       The leader will register to receive multicast on this channel.

props.name: priority
props.description: How strongly this node feels it should be leader.

props.name: priorityLessThan
props.description: Function that provides a strict total ordering on the priority.  Default is "<".

props.name: electionTimeout
props.description: Number of milliseconds to wait before declaring victory on an election.

props.name: electionTimeout
props.description: Number of milliseconds to wait before declaring victory on an election.

props.name: states
props.description:
State machine states the participant will register and react to given their assigned category.
       Default states listed are always applied and need not be passed in configuration.

props.name: leader
props.description: Any state that the participant should deem itself the leader of its group.

props.name: member
props.description: Any state that the participant should deem itself a member (not leader) of its group.

props.name: election
props.description: Any state that the participant should deem itself in an election with its group.

props.name: queueing
props.description: Any state that the participant should block non-election messages until not in a queueing state

classitems.description:
Route a packet to the appropriate handler. The routing path is based upon the action and whether a resource is defined. If the handler does not exist, it is routed to defaultHandler(node,packetContext) Has Resource: handleAction(node,packetContext) No resource: rootHandleAction(node,packetContext) Where "Action" is replaced with the packet's action, lowercase with first letter capitalized (e.g. "doSomething" invokes "handleDosomething") Note that node will usually be null for the rootHandlerAction calls.
  • Pre-routing checks
    • Permission check
    • ACL Checks (todo)
    • Precondition checks
  • Post-routing actions
    • Reply to requester
    • If node version changed, notify all watchers

Detect browser support for structured clones. Returns quickly since it
caches the result. This method only determines browser support for structured
clones. Clients are responsible, when accessing capabilities that rely on structured
cloning, to ensure that objects to be cloned meet the criteria of the structured clone
algorithm. (See ozpIwc.util.safePostMessage for a method which handles attempts to
clone an invalid object.). NB: a bug in FF will cause file objects to be treated as
non-cloneable, even in FF versions that support structured clones.
(see https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=722126).
